testimony: (continued)   Thank you Mr Chairperson.  Mr Nosenga, when you entered the township in the casspir now, did you see any people or any person of the township walking around or standing around?
Yes, there were people walking in the street, some of them died.
When you entered the township and saw these people for the first time, what were they doing?
They were walking in the street.
Did you see any person who defended the township, or who looked as if he is on duty to defend the township at the stage when he entered the township?
No, I just saw people walking in the township.
So I take it, when you entered the township, you did not see any people sitting around, because you say you only saw people walking around?
I said I saw people walking in the evening.

In your statement, on page 21 paragraph 17, and just to remind you that is the statement that was taken by Mr Kjellberg, paragraph 17 you say
"...  we all entered the township from the field side on different streets.  The people and the casspirs were split up.  I do not know the time of the attack, but I know it was dark."
	Then you said -
"... I saw how people were sitting around open fires surrounding the township, run away when they saw us."
	In the light of the fact ...
Sorry, we didn't get the translation of that.
I was just rectifying a mistake with him Chairperson.
Can you just repeat the answer please?
No, the Interpreter is just correcting something with him,  just trying to work something out.
I saw people in the street walking and when we started firing, they ran away.
No, but what do you say to the statement that was put to you?
I cannot say about the statement, I saw people who were walking and when shots were fired, they ran away.
At any stage during the attack, did you see an open fire?
No, I didn't see any fire.  I said I saw people walking in the township.  When shots were fired, some of them fled.
The casspir that was with you, could it drive freely in the streets of Boipatong, or were some of the streets barricaded?
The casspir went into the township, but I can say that the casspir went into the township easily without any barricade.
In the casspir in which you travelled, did the casspir have any difficulty in driving around the township, whilst you were in the casspir?
No, it did not have any difficulty.
After the casspirs split up, did you see any one of the other casspirs during the time you were in the township?
I saw the casspir in which we were travelling.  I saw the casspir in which I was travelling, they split up, these casspirs split up.
Yes, but the question is, after the split, and up to the stage you left the township, did you see any one of the other casspirs, did you come across any one of the other casspirs again?
I last saw them all together at the veld at Boipatong, and I only drove around in the casspir that I have mentioned before.

Mr Nosenga, just listen to the question please.  The question is not whether you saw them together or not, the question is did you see any one of those casspirs again while you were in Boipatong, after the time that you left your casspir until the time that you left the township?  Do you understand the question?  Do you understand the question, just listen?
I said I only saw the casspir that I was travelling in.
You mentioned that Gatchene was one of the people in your casspir, is that right?
Yes, that is what I said.
And you also said that he is an Induna, is that correct?
Yes, that is how I know him to be.
So would you say that he was the person in charge or the leader of the group that you were in during the attack?
And Dondo was also one of the members in that group, is that right?
So Dondo was not the person in charge of that group or the leader of the group, it was Gatchene?
At the time when we fired shots at the people, he is the person who commanded us to do so, but whilst we were in the casspir, Gatchene was - I will say Gatchene was in charge.
Did Gatchene also get out of the casspir at any stage?
Yes, he did get out of the casspir, but I was with the other three people, I was not with him when we attacked.
At what stage did the Policemen in your casspir, put on their balaclavas?
When the casspir travelled from the veld in Boipatong, that is when they put on the balaclavas.
Was it only the Policemen that put on balaclavas?

Why did you say in paragraph 17 of your statement
"... some of our people did also wear balaclavas, but not me?"
No, I stated that the hostel residents were headbands, and it was the Police who wore balaclavas, when we went to Boipatong.
Is the position then that you did not say that some of our people put on balaclavas?
No, even yesterday I mentioned that we were wearing headbands.
During the course of the attack, did you see any white people that painted their faces black?
Yes, but I am not referring to balaclavas, I am just ...
Yes, there were some who were painted black.
That is now without balaclavas, but with painted faces, is that correct?
They did wear them, they did wear balaclavas.
Just to get clarity, so you say they painted their faces black and then they put balaclavas over the painted faces?
Yes, they had put something on their faces, although I do not know what it was, and they did wear balaclavas as well.
Where did you see these people?
At the spot where we came up on the casspirs in the veld.
These people were they part of the group that were in your casspir, or from other casspirs?
I saw them in my casspir, the casspir that I was travelling in.
Now we know the Policemen in your casspir, Chaka, Peens, Rooikop and another person.  Did Peens paint his face?
Yes.  They had painted themselves, I even saw them in the township.
Mr Nosenga, please stop looking at the document next to your Attorney, do you understand?
Speak up when - don't just mumble, we don't hear what you say.
You said Peens painted his face and Rooikop?
Yes, I said the Boers had painted themselves.
And the driver of that casspir, did he also paint his face?
That is correct.  Although I did not know him.
Why didn't you say in your statement that Peens and Rooikop painted their faces?
I do know that they had painted themselves and they wore balaclavas.  It was only the black people who had not painted their faces.
Is the position that Peens painted his face?
Yes, he had smeared something on his face.
Did he paint all his face?
He had just painted the areas that he is indicating.
So he painted the entire face, but for the eyes?
And thereafter he put on the balaclava?

I want to refer you to paragraph 18 on page 21 of that statement.  I will read it to you
"... we got out of the casspir on the first street that we entered."
	Is that correct?
"... we got out of the casspir on the first street that we entered."
I did state that we took cover when we came upon the first house and the casspir that we had been travelling in, drove slowly down the road.
Yesterday you indicated the place where you entered the township, and that was the first street.  In that street, did you go from house to house shortly after you had entered?
Yes, I started before that.  We went into the first house and there were houses on both sides of the street.
Yes, you said in evidence in chief that you went to five houses.  All I want to know is if these houses are in that first street and in close proximity to each other?
The question was, were they in close proximity to each other, in other words, were they attaching each other or near by each other, one after the other?  That is what you are being asked.
That is correct.  The houses are close to one another.
Yesterday I asked you about the first house and second house you went into.  Now I want to ask you about the third house.  What happened in the third house you went into?
As we got there, some of us broke windows and we went inside the house.  There were people inside.
What did you do with your AK47 in that house?
Did you fire shots at people?
Were you close to these people when you fired these shots?
I do not remember, but I did fire shots at them.
Did you kill people in that house?
Can you give the Commission any indication how many people you killed in the third house?
If I am not mistaken it could be three.
Can you say if they were women, children or adults, men?
Now when you say you killed, if you remember, although you don't remember very well, you think you killed three people, how do you know that these people died?
They fell close to me and I am therefore sure that they died.
Yes, I saw them falling down.
And then you assumed that they had died?
Yes, I thought so because they were very close to me.  Thereafter I went looking under the beds, but found no one.
How many magazines did you have for this AK47?
How many bullets were in each one of these magazines?
It could take 40.  It was a steel magazine and it could take 40 bullets.
Apart from the magazine that was in the chamber of this AK47, you had another one somewhere on your body, is that correct?
I had two magazines and one was facing down, that is the one I was using at the time.
What he is indicating is that, he is showing that the one points up and the one points down, it is quite a common way of having two magazines on an AK.
Did you empty the two magazines during the attack?
Did you count afterwards how many bullets you had left?
Did you empty one of the magazines?
I do not want to tell a lie, I do not remember, but I fired shots.

I want to refer you to paragraph 23 on page 22 of your statement.  I am going to read it to you
"... during the attack I finished four cartridges, cases, with about 30 rounds in each."
	Which would mean 120 bullets.  What do you say about that?
I do not know anything about that.
Mr Nosenga, I have been asking you to please speak up.
I don't know anything about that.
You deny what is stated here?
I said I had two magazines that could take 40 bullets, now he is telling me about a magazine that takes 30 bullets.

In paragraph 23 of your statement you are recorded as having stated that during that attack, you finished four cartridge  cases with about 30 rounds in each, do you understand that?  You say that is not true?
And you never said that to Mr Kjellberg who took the statement?  Is that correct?
No sir.  I did not have a magazine of that kind.
The question is, you did not say that to the person who took the statement from you?
According to you, you have killed people in the first, second and third house.  The fourth house, what happened there?
We also found people there and we went into the house.
Did you again fire these shots at people that were close to you?
Yes, but not too close.  They could have been that far away from me.
You have indicated a distance, can you just state which distance did you indicate here?
Are you referring to the grey box that is just behind me?
Yes.  From where I am, it could be as far as that box.
Just for record purposes I estimate it between two and three metres.  So you couldn't miss the person at that distance with the AK, is that correct?
How many metres are there in a pace?
A metre is a bit longer than a pace.  It depends on whose pace it is, Mr Chairman.
What I am putting to you is that over that distance, you would not miss a person if you aim and shoot at him or her?
You had an AK47, you fired a shot or shots at the person approximately two to three metres from you.  Under those circumstances, did you miss that person or did you hit that person?
I shot at most people inside the house and I saw them falling.  I don't know if there were others that I could have missed.
Mr Nosenga, what is the answer, did you hear the question?

Thank you Mr Chairman, what I am stating is that over the distance of two to three paces, the distance that you showed at the Commission here, you could not miss the person with the AK47 you were shooting with, is that correct?
So would you say that you killed people in the fourth house?
Did you kill people in the fourth house you went into?
I fired at people in that house.
How many people did you fire at?
I think it was just one person if I am not mistaken.
Every time you come out of one of these houses, you find the casspir in the street, is that what you are saying?
It was driving slowly and the people in the casspir, were shooting at the people in the streets.
So obviously the people in the streets that ran away, would have seen this casspir?
I do not know, but the people were fleeing, but because there was light, I should assume that they saw the casspir.
And then you went into the fifth house.  Did you kill people in that house?
Yes, I got into the fifth house and shot and killed as well.
How many people did you kill in that house?
Two of them if I am not mistaken.
If we add the five houses together, the people that you killed in those houses, how many people would you say did you kill in total?

In your statement you said
"... I think I killed eight or nine people,"
	would you say that is more or less correct?
No, I said I went into five houses.  I am saying I went into the first house, I don't know how many people I killed  in the fifth house, not that I killed nine people in the fifth house.

No, no, you stated earlier that he killed two people in the fifth house, but I want to know if you add all the houses together, all the people that you killed, you say that you killed approximately eight, nine people in the five houses, adding them together?
No, I don't want to tell a lie.
All right.  After the fifth house, did you go into any other house during the course of the attack?
No, I don't remember.  I just walked up the street, others were shooting at the same time.  I only shot again at Slovo Park.
Did you go into houses at Slovo Park?
I shot people in a shack, I did not get into the shack.  I cannot remember whether I got into a shack, but I did shoot people.
Those people you killed in a shack, did you shoot through a window, or right through the shack, or what did you do?  Did you go into it?
Slovo Park is not like the township, you have this precast wall and some fences as well.
Yes, but that is not the question.  Let me ask you in this way, would you say that you killed people in Slovo Park?
Yes, I did shoot people there.
How many people did you shoot at in Slovo Park?
I do not remember.  I do not remember how many people I killed there.
Do you remember shooting at more than one person?
It is possible, because I did shoot people.  There were many of us, I cannot say how many.  I did shoot at people, I cannot say how many people I shot and how many of these people died.
You won't be able to say approximately how many people you killed during the course of the attack?
No, I don't want to tell a lie.  Whether there are people who just got injured, other died, really I cannot say.

Paragraph 19 of the statement, page 21, it is stated here
"... I think I killed eight or nine people that night in eight different houses."
	Let's just apply our minds to the eight or nine people, is that then not correct?
The second mistake in that sentence is that during the night, or that night, in eight different houses.  You didn't go into eight different houses?
No.  I am saying I went into five houses in the township itself, five houses from the first houses.  I did not go into eight houses.
But why did you tell Mr Kjellberg eight houses?

No, maybe the mistake is with the person who was interpreting for me.  I did indicate, I am saying the person who was interpreting, was such that I would stop him at some time.  I only went into five houses.
And that five houses was in the Boipatong Section, not the Slovo Park Section?
At Boipatong, not Slovo Park.  I am saying the township houses at Boipatong.
Mr Nosenga, I want to put it to you that in the area where you described where you entered Boipatong with the casspir, no houses was attacked.
I don't know anything about that.
I can take it further, obviously no people then were killed in those houses.
No, I don't know about that.  We did go into the houses there.

I also want to put it to you that I have checked the post mortem reports, and the post mortem report is a report by the person that examines the body of a deceased person, to get an indication what the cause of death is.  What I am putting to you is that your version, that you shot at least six people, possibly more, probably more with the AK47, does not accord with these post mortem reports.

I don't know about that, but I saying there were AK's there.  I am saying we did have AK47's when we were shooting people, we were not using small guns.  We were not using small guns, we were using big guns like AK's.

Chairperson, I have taken that up with my learned colleague, and she indicated to me that she is prepared to admit the contents of the post mortem reports.  As far as the legal advice for the family is concerned, we've got that memorandum where they set out the causes of death and that has been admitted between the applicant and the family in terms of that document, but the outstanding admission would have been between the legal advisor for the 17th applicant, Mr Nosenga, and she is prepared to admit the contents of that.
Do you confirm that Ms Tanzer?
I do confirm that, I admit the report.

Mr Chairman, I would just like Adv Strydom to place on record the conversation that we had concerning, we did raise the question of the post mortems, it was common cause between Mr Strydom and myself, the post mortem reports do not indicate that AK bullets were not used to kill persons.  I can't agree with what Adv Strydom is saying, he conceded in our discussion yesterday that there was no proof that no AK was used, arising from the post mortem so I am bewildered by what he is putting.
I have gone through all the post mortem reports and the reply or the memorandum and the reply, and from that I gather the following.
I think the issue really turns on whether the post mortem report indicates that the AK47 were not used on the day in question, is that the issue?
That is the issue, thank you Mr Chairman.
I will state that, the reports do not indicate which weapons were used, but for a few instances where it is stated that a shotgun was used, you can find that in some of the reports.
But if the post mortem report does not indicate the firearm used, excepting for the shotgun, it doesn't exclude the possibility that an AK47 may have been sued?

It does not exclude it, but I want to take it further by stating that in total in Boipatong, eight people died as a result of bullet wounds, three of those and that one can pick up from the post mortem reports, were shot with shotguns, three other people were shot in a house with a 9mm - cartridge picked up.
Okay, just before we get to that, it would not, are you basing this on the reading of the post mortem report?
Yes, the causes of death is stated, it will say in Afrikaans, a [bullet wound or stab wounds], I have counted all the [bullet] wounds in these reports.
Okay.  Could you indicate to us how many gunshot wounds are reflected in the post mortem report?
Yes, 12.  Let me just add again, 12.
On these reports, there is an indication that 12 reports show that there are gunshots, yes, bullet wounds.
Is that in regard to one person?
No, 12 bodies had gun wounds is them.
Mr Berger, have you had sight of the post mortem report?
I have not studied them, Ms Cambanis has studied them.
Ms Cambanis, have you had sight of the post mortem report?

I have, yes, I have.  I have not done this exercise.  I simply raised the question of the gun, whether an AK could or could not have been used.  I have not done the exercise, I cannot dispute what my learned friend is saying.

Okay, so as to make sure that at least if we have to record something, we have to record something that is common cause, could you perhaps during the break see what you could agree on, what is common cause from the post mortem report?
Yes, I can, we can do that.
Yes, I will endeavour to do that.
Yes, just indicate to them what it is that you want to place on record, and give them the opportunity to deal with it.
What I want to place on record is that 12 people died inter alia of a result of being shot with firearms.

Of that 12, three were shot with a shotgun.  Three people who lived in 765 Hlubi Street and I must state here, there is doubt if it is two or three, but I will state three, died inter alia of a result of bullet wounds and I also seek to get the admission that 9mm cartridges were picked up in that house.  Four people in Slovo Park died as a result of bullet wounds, and two other people died as a result of bullet wounds and those people are in the Boipatong area, not Slovo Park.  If that is all added together, then it adds to 12.
Okay, so far on we know the - my arithmetic is deserting me here, the nine people may well have been killed by means of an AK47?

Yes, but I am excluding a further three people, in 765 Hlubi Street, because there were cartridges picked up in that house, 9mm cartridges, and there was evidence during this hearing about what happened in that house.
Yes.  And then giving you the benefit of the doubt then, then we are left with about six people who could have been killed by AK47's?
Possibly, but four of those six have got Slovo Park addresses, so it is left with two people that could possibly be killed with inter alia AK47 bullets.
Yes, I understand that, yes.  Okay.
If I may Chair, if my learned colleague able to say how many people were wounded as a result of gunshot wounds on this night in question, once he is putting the question of gunshots?
I think we can find out from him.
Unfortunately there are no post mortem reports in that regard.  I won't be able to say that.

That I haven't got, but I can look at the evidence, I've got all the evidence in relation to the people that had been injured, and I will be able to state that as well, maybe not with total accuracy, that I will have to concede.
Okay.  Ms Cambanis, will you therefore consider these matters that Mr Strydom has placed on record?
We will do that at tea time, thank you Chair.
Will you let us know?  You don't have to do that today, you can do that on Monday.

Thank you Chairperson.  Mr Nosenga, assuming for a moment that the figures that I have stated, is correct, I want to put to you that you couldn't have killed so many people with an AK47 as you are stating.
No, I don't know about that.  I am saying I shot people using an AK47.  I still maintain they were AK47's, these firearms were used.  I shot people.
I want to put to you as a fact, that in close proximity, houses in close proximity to each other, not so many people died as you want to tell this Committee?
I don't know about that, I am saying many people died, and some of them ran away.
Apart from the people that you fired shots at and killed according to you in these five houses, did the other people that were with you, also kill people in those houses?

Yes, there are some people who fired shots.  I know specifically the third if not the fourth house, from the first house.  In the first house, I am the one who fired shots, and I am not sure about the third or fourth house.
If you are not sure, what are you not sure about?  What happened at the third or fourth house?
I am not sure how many of us went into those houses.  I am the first one to fire shots in the first house.
The question is did you see in one of these five houses, that any other person in your company, killed people in those houses?
I am saying yes, someone in the name of Dondo did fire shots.  You did ask me that question as to whether I alone fired shots, and I said others fired shots too.
But do you know if he hit somebody with the shots he fired or don't you know?
Would you please repeat the question?
You said Dondo also fired shots in the third or fourth house.  What I want to know is could you see if he hit someone with the bullets he was firing?
I heard a gunshot in the house and I was concentrating at the people that I was shooting.
Do you know what weapon he was carrying?
No, it is a small gun, I did indicate that I don't know the names.
Why did you stop shooting after the fifth house?

I just stopped on my own, with an intention of using the bullets at Slovo Park, but others continued shooting on that very same street.  Others did not shoot of course, but others continued shooting right through Slovo Park, right through to Slovo Park.
So the last shot you fired, was in the fifth house, and after that you fired shots again in Slovo Park, is that what you are saying?
Did you say that you wanted to save the rest of your ammunition for Slovo Park?
No, he did not ask me that question.  He wanted to know what I did from the fifth house.

After the fifth house, why did you stop shooting?  That was the question.  You give a lengthy answer, amongst which you said I wanted to save the rest of my ammunition for Slovo Park.  Now I want to find out from you, did you say that you wanted to save the rest of your ammunition for Slovo Park?

After you left the fifth house, and you were now on your way to Slovo Park, can you give any indication as to the route that you followed now to get to Slovo Park?  Did you carry straight on in that same street, did you make a turn somewhere, or can you give any indication?

We proceeded right through the same street.  There is one main taxi route, and we proceeded towards the hostel.  We proceeded towards the mixed sex hostel, and we proceeded towards Sharkville or Sharpeville where there is a clump of trees and we got out of the township.
I just wanted to know, from the place where you went into the houses, you say you carried right through to Slovo Park, is that right?

Yes.  From the last house that I shot in, there is a main route, a taxi route, and there is a big shop around there, as well as a taxi rank.   We proceeded as if we were going towards Sharpeville, but before we got there, there is a clump of trees and there are a lot of shacks around there and that was Slovo Park.
So you went passed the shops and a taxi rank on your way to Slovo Park?
And these shops you refer to, are they more or less in the middle of Boipatong?

Yes, there are houses around, and there is also this hostel in Boipatong that I referred to.  There is also a taxi rank nearby.  We then took the route towards Sharpeville.  There are a lot of trees around there, as well as shacks.  That is where we arrived at.
Can I just clarify something Mr Strydom.  Did I hear you correctly that you went on one road the whole way through, you didn't go off that road?  You stayed on the same road the whole way through?

No,  I said we took that street and we turned somewhere and took the route, the taxi route and before you come to the Boipatong hostel, there is a taxi rank as well as a big shop.  We proceeded on the route towards Sharpeville and before you get there, there is a clump of trees, and a lot of shacks, that is the spot at which we arrived.
Do you know where the park is in Boipatong?
I will be telling a lie.
What happened when you arrived in Slovo Park?
People were fired at, some were stabbed with spears and some were hacked with axes.  But we shot at them as well.
How many people did you fire at, at Sharpeville?
I said I do not remember.
Sorry, I said Sharpeville, that is Slovo Park, sorry.  Peens, did he fire any shots?
I will be telling a lie.  I don't know, I last saw him firing on the streets in the township.
Now you are now in Slovo Park, where are the casspirs at this stage?
The casspirs were travelling with us.  I did see them in Slovo Park, because we were on foot, and they were in our company, they were accompanying us.
Were you, from the very first house, the casspir in which you were ...
Yes, it was always accompanying us, it was driving slowly along the road, and the people in the casspir, were shooting at people fleeing in the streets.
And then when you proceeded to Slovo Park, it also went to Slovo Park?
Yes, it was driving slowly with us, until we arrived at Slovo Park.
At the fifth house, to go to Slovo Park, the casspir also went with you to Slovo Park?
What about the rest of the people in your group, did they remain in Boipatong?
We all went to Slovo Park.
Did somebody say well, "let's go to Slovo Park", or was it just an individual decision?
I do not remember, but somebody did state that we should go to Slovo Park.
After the fifth house, someone said "let's go to Slovo Park?"
I am saying that it is possible that it happened.
Or someone didn't?  Did someone say right, "let's now go to Slovo Park"?
I do not remember, but we did proceed to Slovo Park.
What made you  go to Slovo Park?
They said we should go to Slovo Park?
So someone said "let's go to Slovo Park?"
I said yes, there is somebody who stated that, but I do not remember who.
And then you went to Slovo Park, together with the casspirs?
On your way to Slovo Park, was that hostel you referred to, attacked?
It was attacked on our way from Slovo Park, people who were standing outside the hostel, were shot at.
Did you shoot people at that hostel?
No, I did not.  I only fired shots in the township and in Slovo Park.
But isn't the hostel also in the township?
It is in the township.  It is a mixed sex hostel.

I want to refer you to paragraph 21 on page 21 of the statement.  It reads as follows
"... we walked through the township attacking houses, on the way to Slovo Park, which was  squatter camp on one side of the township, we also attacked a hostel.  There were most women in the hostel."
	It was stated here that on the way to Slovo Park, you attacked the hostel, and not on your way back.  What is the truth now?
I deny that.  The hostel was the last place to be attacked on our way from Slovo Park.

And then it reads
"... we continued the shooting in Slovo Park."
	So clearly what you wanted to say in this statement was that you attacked the hostel before you got to Slovo Park.  Is it again just a wrong statement?
No, I deny what is contained in that statement.  The hostel was the last place to be attacked, on our way from Slovo Park.
When you are going to Slovo Park, did you have to go passed the hostel?
Yes, it was on our side and we turned in the opposite direction, but on our way from Slovo Park we went passed the hostel, and people were shot at there.
How many people did you kill at the hostel?
I stated that I did not shoot anyone at the hostel.  I last fired my gun in Slovo Park, I did not fire at anyone in the hostel.
And the other people with you, did they fire shots at people which you could see, injured or killed people at the hostel?
Yes, some of them did shoot directing their shots towards the hostel.
And you in fact saw people falling down?
Yes, I did see them although I did not fire shots personally, but I did see people falling down.
I will check my notes, but if my memory serves me correctly, under cross-examination of my learned friend, you said that you killed people at the hostel.
I did not kill anyone at the hostel.  I only fired shots in the township houses in Boipatong and as well as at Slovo Park, I did not shoot at anyone at the hostel.
And you gave a description of how you saw the people falling over at the hostel, do you remember that?
I stated that I did see people falling down at the hostel, but I did not shoot.
Let me ask you, in Slovo Park, could this casspir move around amongst these houses?
The casspir did enter Slovo Park and it parked there.  There is a road towards Sharpeville, a dirt road, so the casspir could travel along that road.

Let's just get clarity, so when you reached Slovo Park, did the casspir come to a standstill and remained there until the casspir left Slovo Park again or did it drive around amongst these shacks in Slovo Park?
Slovo Park is a shack area, the casspirs parked, it did not drive around the area until we were finished shooting at the people.
Why do you say casspirs parked?
There were casspirs travelling with us as we went into Slovo Park.  I also stated that in Slovo Park, mostly houses are not fenced.
Yes, but that is the problem that I have, did you see more than one casspir parked in Slovo Park?
More than one.   The casspirs also proceeded to Slovo Park.
How many casspirs did you see in Slovo Park?
So would you say that the casspirs you initially saw, rejoined when they got to Slovo Park, or regrouped?
Sir, after we had attacked the township, the casspirs regrouped and they followed our casspir.   The other casspirs followed the one in which I had been travelling towards Slovo Park.
Where did this regrouping start, still in the township Boipatong, or only at Slovo Park?
I noticed them on our way to Slovo Park.
Do you have any knowledge how it came about that the four casspirs got together again or was that coincidence?
No, I do not know, but I did see them proceeding towards Slovo Park.  I cannot say how they regrouped.
When the casspirs got together, did the people that went along with these casspirs, then all got together so there was one group again?
Yes, that is so.   When we left Boipatong, I saw another group following us, because the streets were parallel to one another, so I saw one other group joining ours.
Why did you testify earlier today that the last occasion you saw the other casspirs, was when you entered the township?

No sir, that is not what I said.  I said the casspir I had been travelling with, accompanied us, it was driving slowly along the streets.  Peens and others did not enter the premises of those houses, but they remained in the casspir.

No Mr Nosenga, I asked you if during the course of the attack, if you ever saw the other casspirs again, and you said no, "the last time I saw the casspirs together, was when you entered the township."  Now you say you in fact saw the other casspirs just before you entered Slovo Park, they regrouped?
I said I last saw them as we entered the township, because they split up when we entered the township.
I know you said that, but after that I asked you did you see them again during the course of the attack and you said no, you never saw them again.  Do you remember that?
I was referring to the attack on Boipatong, the township.  You had not asked me with regards to Slovo Park.  When we entered the township, the casspirs split up.
But even according to your own version now, they regrouped before they entered Slovo Park, so you saw them then again in Boipatong?

Sir, what I am saying is that the other casspirs followed the one that I had been travelling in towards Slovo Park.  In the township I did not see them, I last saw them when we entered the township, because when we got there, the casspirs split up according to different streets.
Is the situation that when your casspir, the casspir in which you had been travelling, went towards Slovo Park, the other casspirs followed it, is that what happened?
Yes, that is what I am saying, they followed the casspir that I had been travelling in because as we moved towards the tarred road, they followed.
All the casspirs then went to Slovo Park?
Yes.   I said I saw all four at Slovo Park.
They were just waiting outside, they did not enter the   Slovo Park?
Yes, they waited outside on the road, and we entered the area and killed people and when we were finished, and we were moving towards the Boipatong hostel,  that is where people were shot.
Okay, and then the casspirs also followed you towards the hostel?
That is correct.  There is a question that was not clarified, property was looted.
No, I am not asking you about any items.  I am just asking you about the casspirs.
Yes.  The casspirs now are on their way towards the hostel in Boipatong?
Yes.  They were turning towards  that road.  That is where other members of our group shot at people in the hostel.
But the casspirs were with you as you were going towards the hostel, the mixed hostel where shooting occurred?
Yes, there is a main road there.
Okay, and then from there, and this hostel is in Boipatong?
And all four of these casspirs went to this hostel?
The casspirs did join us as we went towards the hostel in Boipatong, and that is where people were shot at.
Yes, but were the casspirs at the hostel?
Could I just check one thing Mr Strydom.  After that, did they carry on with you back to the hostel, these casspirs?
They left before us, and we followed on foot.  After people were shot at the Boipatong hostel, the casspirs left to Madala hostel and then we as one group followed on foot.
Okay.  So at that time, all the attackers were one group?
So where did you all regroup as attackers?  At that hostel?  Where, I am not sure?
We regrouped at the hostel and that is where people were shot at, and we regrouped and decided that we must go back to the hotel, kwaMadala hostel.
The time now is just after eleven o'clock, do you still have a lot of ground to cover?
I am going in sequence, so I will move on after tea, if it is convenient, I think I will be busy for some time still, yes.
Mr Strydom, just after tea on Wednesday, I found that piece of evidence that you were talking about.
About what happened at the hostel?
Yes.  He said very clearly that he did not fire any shots at that place.
I will accept that, I withdraw that question then.
And that it was the last place in the attack?
Yes, he said that he last fired shots at the shacks, he was quite clear about that.

Very well, we will take the tea adjournment and then return at half past eleven.
COMMITTEE ADJOURNS

Sorry Chairperson, just before we proceed, we have made available to the parties involved, three documents. There are two documents, and then the third document is a register of the visitors of the prisoners.
